message: Starting analysis of senior engineer thinking patterns - examining mental models and decision-making processes
Analyzing error-first thinking and defensive programming patterns
Analyzing completeness mindset and the definition of "done"
Analyzing questioning assumptions and skeptical thinking patterns
Analyzing impact thinking and consequences prediction patterns
Finalizing analysis - documenting the meta-pattern of self-review

Investigation complete. Successfully identified and documented 6 critical senior engineer thinking patterns with concrete, actionable behaviors: 1) Read-First Development (60-80% reading vs 20-40% writing), 2) Error-First Thinking (mental simulation of failure modes), 3) Completeness Mindset (rigorous definition of 'done'), 4) Skeptical Verification (question everything, verify assumptions), 5) Impact Radius Thinking (map dependencies and blast radius), 6) Ruthless Self-Review (critique own work before submission). Each pattern includes specific behaviors, automatic questions, verification checklists, and junior anti-patterns. All findings are implementable in agent prompts.
